DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Mechanisms CBT4CBT Alcohol Use Disorders
DOC.detailed_description: Evaluate efficacy CBT4CBT clinician-delivered CBT relative standard treatment reduce alcohol use 8-week randomized trial 6-month follow-up . Our primary hypothesis either form CBT effective standard treatment increase percentage day abstinent treatment ( 8 week ) follow-up ( 6 month ) , assess via Timeline FollowBack interview .
DOC.criteria: Individuals include : Are 18 year age old . Are apply outpatient alcohol treatment meet current DSM5 criterion alcohol use disorder , consume least 14/7 drink ( men/women ) per week least 4 heavy drinking day report past 28 day , Are sufficiently stable 8 week outpatient treatment commit 6month followup Are willing provide locator information followup , Are fluent English 6th grade high read level . Individuals exclude : Have untreated bipolar schizophrenic disorder , Have current legal case pending incarceration 8week protocol likely , Have prescribe alcohol pharmacotherapy ( e.g. , disulfiram , naltrexone ) within past two week , Are physically dependent alcohol , opioids benzodiazepenes immediate medical detoxification necessary safety purpose ( individual demonstrate significant withdrawal symptom would eligible rescreening follow brief medical detoxification , arrange RCS staff triage ) .
